intro: Delima oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxacan delima, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, round fruits that are edible and have a slightly tart flavor. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
